captions.text: Gorky Film Studio
SEVENTEEN MOMENTS OF SPRING
Part 5
Find that special agent for me.

But do it secretly. Only three people 
must know about that.
You, me and that agent himself.

How long will you keep lying to me, 
you dirty swine?!

If you won't start talking now, 
I will skin you alive!
Listen to me carefully, Runge.

I do not want your death, 
I only want to help you.

but you must help me too a little. 
Do you understand that?
I don't understand what you want.

I want you to honestly tell me how did 
you end up in the prison hospital?
You are a healthy person.
I had bad analyses.
Who did it for you?!

I asked the doctors. They said that 
you were healthy as a horse.
You were healthy! Who did it for you?!

This is just terrible! 
Stop this disgrace at once!
Get out of here now!
You must understand him, Runge.

Yesterday his wife and two children 
were killed in an air raid.
Would you like a cigarette?
No need to cry. Please calm down.
Why did he shout at you?

You didn't want to say that you were 
transferred to the hospital by Shtirlitz?

You are a funny guy, Runge. 
Shtirlitz is our comrade.

He is one of us. You just didn't want 
him to get in trouble, did you?

You cannot be responsible 
for his actions.

He himself offered to you to go to 
the hospital, didn't he?

Write down the way it all happened, and 
we will consider the incident closed.

Now they will bring you coffee. Here is a pen. 
You'll sit down and write everything.
And now go to sleep.
Thank you.
He is so stupid! And so naive in life.

Let him have a nap for 10 minutes, then 
wake him up again for the interrogation.

Beat him so hard that he would howl 
like an animal and ask for only one:

What was he proposed by a man who 
interrogated him the very first time.

Right now I am only interested to
get his answer to this question.

It is necessary to knock out his 
confession within next 2 days.

- Could you please help me? 
- I am sorry, but we are closed.
It is quite important.

- Is it really that important? 
- Yes, it is.

We are preparing for evacuation. 
Can you come back tomorrow?

I will not have free time tomorrow. 
Could you, please, help me today?

-What are you looking for? 
-I am looking for Meyvers of 1857 of Leipzig.

Professor Nikeilberg could help you best 
with that, but he is sick in the hospital.

So, does this mean that no one 
can help me right now?
You may try asking professor Pleyshner.
Thank you.

- Are you here to see me? 
- Yes.
Good day.

-You are Mr.... 
-Mr. Shtirlitz.

Mr. Shtirlitz, Oh God! 
I haven't seen you for so long.

-And I saw you very recently. 
-When? At my brother's funeral?
And, you were there too?

-I have a request. 
-Yea, I am listening.

-I am looking for Meyvers book, 
by Leipzig publication only.

-I am sorry, what is your request? 
-I am looking for Meyvers, by Leipzig publication.

I am afraid, we sent it to the 
mountains for storage already.
but I will try to look.
And you are sure a very sly person.

Asking Meyversa from me now it is like 
asking for a ton of margarine from you.

-You simply wanted to see me, right? 
-Yes.

Nevertheless the art skills of Greeks 
are excessively humanistic.

Romans are harder, apparently, they 
are closer to us, Great Germans.

That's why Mussolini considers 
Julius Caesar the first fascist.

Greeks worry about a human, and Romans 
worry about an idea and internal logic.

A hero is an object for imitations. 
Children play heroes in games.
Why aren't you saying anything?

Why aren't you objecting? 
You are, indeed, thinking that way.

You do not like powerful body trunks 
and the proudly planted stupid heads.
No?

- You did indeed have some troubles. 
- Troubles?

Are you calling a concentration 
death camp just a trouble?

You know they taught me there to 
only argue with those,
whom it is possible to trust.

And I trusted only one person. 
My brother.

How is it possible to live 
without trust at all?

- I live. I live.
- And I have a reason to trust you.
Please go to the bomb shelter.
All of that is in vain!

I only manage to run as far as
 half of the length of our corridor.

If to die then it is better here. 
Reflex of fear.

What did we talk about?
I forgot where we ended with it.
Oh, yes, here is your book.
You said that you trust me. Why?
I do not know. I just do!

INFORMATION FOR ANALISYS. 
MARTIN BORMAN

Reichsleiter. Deputy of the Fuhrer 
in the German Nazi party.

Married, has eight children. 
Convicted of a crime. Was in jail.
Education - middle school only.

About Bormann, like everyone in 
the Reich, Shtirlitz knew very little.

They were saying that he was in 
prison for a political murder.

And then, he escaped from jail, 
then after granted amnesty,

He joined Hitler's party. 
It became the secretary of Hess.

Hess was the only person, who was 
permitted to say "hey" to Fuhrer.

After becoming the successor 
of Hess, who flew to England,

Borrman ordered to the Gestapo to 
kill all of his former co-workers

who have worked with him in 
the main Nazi party office.

He was still imperceptible, staying 
away from movie cameras,

He rarely was appearing at the 
solemn party meetings.

He was emphasizing respectful 
with Goering, Goebbels and Himmler.

He changed only after that day, when 
the Fuhrer named him his shadow.

Bormann prepared the most important 
political speeches of Hitler.

Bormann was reporting each morning about 
the situation in the country and abroad.

Bormann was deciding if the Fuehrer 
will or will not have time for Goebbels,

if he will invite Mussolini to 
the dinner or not.

Shtirlitz, like many others in the SD, 
knew that the Fuhrer in the past years

would not make any important decision 
without consulting with Bormann.

Thinking about Bormann, Shtirlitz was 
returning to that single fact,

which he heard, conversing once 
with Schulenburg. He said:

"Bormann is shaking reichsfyurer's hand, 
but he wants to kill him or bury him alive".

It is possible to expect anything 
from that person.
Shtirlitz decided to count on Bormann in his game.

Firstly, because he knows now 
Himmler's position,

who betrayed Fuhrer by the fact of his
secret negotiations with the West,

and secondly, there was no one else 
with such a great political power.

Neither Goering or Goebbels possessed 
any real political authority any longer.

So, then it is him: "The shadow of Hitler". 
Martin Bormann.
So, Martin Bormann, received
This letter via secret mail delivery from SD

With writing on it "top secret. 
To open personally."

"Partaygenosse (Party Leader) Bormann! 
Some people behind Fuhrer's back

"started negotiations of surrender to the 
representatives of those rotted through out

"western democracies in Sweden 
and Switzerland.
"This is done during the total war,

"when the future of the world is fought 
for on the battle fields.

"Being an SD officer, I could be able
to inform you about the details

of these treacherous negotiations. 
But I require a necessary guaranty,
because, if this letter is found by SD men,
I will be immediately terminated.

For this very reason only 
I do not sign my name.

"If you consider that my this 
communication to you is important,

"then please be tomorrow in the hotel 
"Am NoeThor" at 1:00 PM.

Truly devoted to the Fuhrer. 
A member of NSDAP" (Nazi Party).
Office of reichsleiter Bormann.
How are you, Mr. Ribbentrop.

Reichsleiter is busy right now. 
I will connect you in 10 minutes.
In 30 minutes.

"What is this, a provocation?"
-thought Bormann, "Hardly."

Did a crazy one write this? 
Also very unlikely. Too smart.
It does sound like the truth.

He wanted to call Muller the chief of the Gestapo. 
He knew that Muller will do anything for him.

What if the author of the letter is from the 
Gestapo? And Muller is also in this game?

Rats run from the sinking ship. 
Everything is possible.

But this could be a very good 
play card against Himmler.

Then I could be able quietly, -though Bormann, 
without any problems from Himmler

to transfer all party means to my 
bank accounts instead of his.

Bormann was thinking, but he could 
not come up to a conclusion.

Shtirlitz was going to the secret 
meeting with Bormann.

He was, for some reason, confident, that 
Bormann will come to the secret meeting.

“When the times are difficult, they are 
yielding more” -thought Shtirlitz.

Shtirlitz drove a little extra.
Just to make sure there is no “Tail”.

"Tail", if this was a tail, a surveillance, 
it was not there any more.

How’re you doing? I haven't seen you 
for a while, my old friend.

I hope you will enjoy your beer. 
Today we’ve got great Bavarian beer on tab.

Did you read the latest news? 
Serve beer there and quick.

As soon as Bavarian beer arrives 
everyone appears here right away.

"The tail!" That was the surveillance
tail after him. Without a doubt.

If they will continue with surveillance, 
this means that something bad happened.
What could have happened?

What could have happened? 
Kept asking himself Shtirlitz.

He did not expect messengers from the Center, 
hence failure could not be from that side.

Old "business"? The detectives have 
no time to cope with new cases not

even talking about the old ones. 
Wait a minute! Ervin and Ket Kinn!

What if they did find the suitcase 
with the spy radio transmitter inside!?

I made a mistake. I should have personally 
checked all the hospitals to make sure.

What if they are alive and injured? 
I should not have relied on calls.

Everything must be verified. And 
immediately. Maybe even today.

That was not a "Tail", -thought Shtirlitz. 
Maybe it just seemed to me?

Maybe, Shellenberg decided to test me 
before the operation with pastor Shlag?

And maybe I am just loosing it. 
Bad nerves.

He was going through the park to 
the Museum of Nature.

He went through the park, which 
belonged to the Sharitte hospital.

And he did not know that precisely 
in this very hospital
is "his" Ket now. Ketrine Kinn.

At this square in an hour he will have 
a meeting with Bormann.
He specifically selected this place.

Here everything could be examined 
easily from a distance.

Everything was quiet and there were 
no activities at the square.

"However, thought Shtirlitz, they could 
have their people in the hotel.

What if Bormann reported everything to 
Himmler, then the Gestapo will be here.

And if not, then Bormann’s people 
would be everywhere on the square

and at the entrance on the opposite 
side of the street.
Shtirlitz was visiting this place often.

It was known that Shtirlitz liked to 
schedule secret meetings
to his agents in museums.

The museum servants, were 
certainly all informants,
they knew him in person by his face.
Shtirlitz was OK with such a circumstance.

There remained 20 minutes 
before his agent Klaus
should come to the meeting.
Shtirlitz sent an encoded note in the morning to
agent Klaus' address.

Urgent telegram. 
I call my agent for 12:40 PM.
Your clock is 2 minutes late.

So now everyone knows that he talks 
with his agents in museums

That encoded note would be the 
justification for his appearance here.

Calling agent Klaus for a meeting, 
Shtirlitz pursued 2 purposes:

An alibi, if Bormann speaks about 
the letter to Himmler,

and Himmler will order to comb 
entire city region,

and secondly, again, at least 
indirectly, confirm

his alibi in the case of the 
disappearance of agent Klaus.

Something was not working correctly, 
not as Shtirlitz has expected.
Bormann did not arrive.
Maybe, Bormann did not receive my letter?

And therefore he did not come 
to this secret meeting.

Bormann was at the conference 
with the Fuehrer.
He did not intend to go to the hotel.

He wanted to meet a man, 
who wrote the letter,

but decided not to rush the events. 
To wait a little.

If this is serious, then this person will, 
without a doubt, appear again.
To Mueller. Top secret.

The owner of a car "Mercedes- Benz" at 
12:27 PM entered the museum building.

Since you warned about the high 
professional preparedness of

the object of observation, I made the 
decision to conduct observation with

one agent pretending to be a visitor 
and another agent performed the task

by bringing students for conducting
the lessons in the museum.

Observational data makes it 
possible to report,

that the object of observation did not 
contact any strangers. V-192.
Mueller is speaking.
Mr. Muller is greeted by Mr. Shellenberg.
Or you like better to be called as a "Master"?
I like a simple friendly "Muller".

It is categorical, modest and 
always with a good taste.

Well I am listening to you, 
my good old friend.

Let's get right to business, otherwise 
he'll leave. He is such a fox.

Listen, my good old friend. 
Shtirlitz just came to me.
He is in some confusion.

Either criminals follow him everywhere, 
and he lives alone in the woods,

either your people have surveillance 
on him. Will you help us in this matter?
What model it his automobile?
What model it his automobile?
Mercedes- Benz.

Don't cover the receiver with your hand. 
May I talk to Shtirlitz directly?

And how do you know about the hand? 
Can you see  through the wall?
Good day to you my good old friend.

Tell me, if the license plate of your 
car could be 661125 by some chance?
Precisely so, gruppenfurer.

Where did they attach to you as "tail"? 
On Kurfyurstendam?

And where did you loose them? 
On Veterarenshtrasse?
Precisely correct.

-Did you discover them right away? 
-Well, and what do you think? Yes.

I'll cut their heads off for 
such a poor job with you.

Don't be disturbed. No criminals were after you. 
Live without worries in the woods in your house.

Those were my people. They confused your 
"Mercedes" with some other similar to yours.

Continue to live, as you were living, 
but if my agents again report to me,

that you were attending a 
sex bar "dark-blue beard",
I will not cover you up for that.

What if I should be in that sex bar 
for my special work duties?

If you like to meet with your agents in 
sex clubs, then go to "Mexico City" night club.
You recommend "Mexico City" bar? Thanks.

That was Muller's favorite sex bar because 
the counter espionage worked there.
Shtirlitz knew this from Shellenberg.

There was published a special order, 
which forbade attending that sex bar to

All members of Nazi party, therefore stupid 
talkers thought that it is safe to talk in there

without knowing that each table was wired 
with microphones by the Gestapo.

Great, thanks. With your permission, 
I will start meeting my agents
exclusively in sex bar "Mexico City" now.

But if I get in trouble in there, 
I will come to you for help.

Come to me. I'll be always glad to help you. 
Hail Hitler.
Shtirlitz did not really believe Muller.

So, in the evening, he ordered 
a special office car.

From Werner to Mueller. 
Top secret.

The object of observation ordered 
a work car at 19:42 in the evening.

He asked the driver to bring him to 
the stop of U-ban "Mitliplatz".

Then he left the car. 
All attempt to locate the object
proved to be unsuccessful. Werner.

I never thought that 
I would miss you.

I do not know, who you are by profession 
or what you do for living.

I only know that you were a friend of 
my deceased brother.

But to me you were always very 
interesting Mr. Shtirlitz.

-Aren't you freezing in here? 
-I freeze to the sheerest stiffness.

And what can I do? Who is not 
freezing nowadays

-In the Hitler's bunker it is nice and warm. 
-This is understandable.
Fuhrer must live in the warmth.

It's impossible even to compare our 
concerns with his concerns and anxieties?
We, the common men only care about ourselves.

And he thinks and cares about all 
the Germans. He deserves warmth.

Come on, professor! 
Enough of this nonsense.

He is a goddamn mad maniac, who 
killed millions, and now he hides,

a dirty bastard, in a safe, warm place 
and watches movies with his girl friend.
Don't you think so?

Well, you see. Your brother and 
my best friend ...

He was an antifascist, an underground 
resistance fighter just like me.

For years he was leading German
underground resistance group.
He was helping me in the fight.
You never asked about my profession.

I am a shtandartenfyurer SS. 
I work in the military intelligence.

No, no, my brother could not be 
a provocateur. I do not believe you.

He never was a provocateur. And I actually 
really work in the military intelligence.

I also work in the Russian 
military intelligence as well.

-Do you remember well the handwriting 
of your brother? - Certainly I do.

Here is a letter he gave me 
before he died.
Friend! I thank you for everything.
I have learned so much from you.

I learned how it is necessary to love, 
and in the name of this love

to hate those, who bring servitude to 
the people of Germany. Your Pleyshner.
He wrote this to me, fearing the Gestapo.

The servitude to the German people, 
as you well understand, will bring

hordes of Russian Bolsheviks and 
armada of Americans, don't you think?

Or maybe, the servitude to Germany was,
actually, brought by Hitler instead?
By the Nazis?

Shtirlitz all of sudden felt sorry, 
that he said all this to him.

And he was sorry for even approaching 
this unhappy old man with “his business”.

Although, why is this a "my business"?
- thought Shtirlitz.

First of all this is their business, a business of 
the Germans. Therefore, his business as well.

I do things for them, but in fact they had 
to do those things themselves.
I understand.
Now I understand everything.
You can completely rely on me.

but I already was in the concentration 
death camp once and I must warn you,

that if they start beating and 
torturing me again

I just will not be able to hold it and 
I could tell them about you.
I do know that.

What did you feel when I told you 
about what I do and who I am?
A relief. An enormous relief.
Then we will work well together.
What must I do now?

Nothing yet. Just live quietly and be ready 
for actions when it will be necessary.

- And for whom will we be fighting? 
- For Germany.

- For Germany? 
- For Germany. But not the Reich.

You will agree, that between those two 
concepts there is an enormous difference.
It is agreeable.
Italy. Military airport Bilsana.

If you would get hit, anything could happen 
in war, you are obligated to burn

this letter even before you will have 
time to unfasten parachute straps.

I cannot burn letter before I will unfasten 
my parachute straps.
because I will be dragged on the ground.

but the first, that I will do, after unfastening 
the straps, is that I will burn letter.
Let us agree to this version.
Here is this letter.

You are obligated to burn it, even if you 
get hit above the Reichstag.
Karl Wolf had all reasons for a fear.

If this letter falls into the hands others 
than except Himmlers,
He would be finished. Terminated.
In 7 hours the letter was opened by Himmler.

Dear reichsfurer! Immediately after 
I have arrived to Bern, Switzerland

I began working with the secret service 
materials, assembled here,

About Allen Dulles' representation in Bern,
I drew the conclusion:
Dulles is most disturbed by a real prospect

of creation in Northern Italy of 
the Communist government,

which will involve the formation of 
the Communist belt through out
Togliattis to Maurice Torez in France.

I just returned from the meeting with the 
representatives of Allen Dulles,
Mr. Gevernits and Mr. Gusman.

Tomorrow, on March 8, will take place 
a meeting with Allen Dulles personally.

Excellent contralto. Nevertheless Italian 
voices are best in the world.

Italians have wonderful voices. Either that 
is from the sea, from a warm sea,
either from the Italian sky.
This is like some mysticism.

- This clock is slow. 
- No, it is accurate.

Well this means, my watch is too fast. 
For two minutes.
I hate waiting!
Outstanding contralto!
Good day.

-Did you have lunch? 
-Yes, we did. Thank you.

Allen Dulles. The chief of US strategic 
forces in Europe.

- What an excellent day it is today! 
- Yes, it is an excellent day.

We are waiting for one more 
of our colleagues.

As soon as he is here we will start 
the talks. He'll be here in a minute.
General, you are aware that,

- the war is lost by Germany? 
- Yes, I understand that we lost the war.

Even though the war is, practically, 
lost by us, Germans, I still don't like

to begin these negotiations 
with such agonizing thought for me.

You must realize, that we'll only  talk
to you if you would consider the idea

- of unconditional German surrender? 
- I understand that.
I do understand that.

But if you, nevertheless, 
want to speak to us on behalf of

Mr. Himmler, then negotiations will 
interrupt, without having begun.
And Mr. Dulles will leave right away.

I consider that the continuation of fighting 
is a crime before the German people

and before the European culture. 
Especially now,
When we undertook steps for these talks.

- You, Germans, undertook those steps! 
- We did them together. America and Germany.

I am ready to grant at your disposal 
my military organization.

This is the most powerful organization in 
Germany which made of SS and SD.
At the disposal of you and your allies.

In order to put an end to the war 
and not to allow a creation of

Communist regimes both 
in Italy and in Germany.

Probably before beginning 
conversations with me and

going ahead with these official 
talks, although they secret ones,

you did establish for yourselves that 
my title is obergruppenfyurer SS.

And my rank is a chief of the personal 
staff of reichsfyurer Himmler.

You said that you would transfer at 
our disposal troops SS and SD,

Does this mean that you will begin 
fighting Wehrmacht, the army?
In particular, the field marshal Kesselring?
Will Kesselring carry out your orders?
I understand you, Mr. Gevernitz.

But to me it is necessary your guarantees, 
so that I could begin my talks

with field marshal Kesselring 
thoroughly and in details.
This is reasonable.

You must understand that as soon as he will 
give an order about the capitulation here,

in Italy, where to us are subordinated 
almost 2 million army people,

immediately will begin a chain 
reaction at other fronts.
In Norway, Denmark and in Germany itself.

At the Eastern front the fight can 
continue with an increasing strength though.
If I obtain your guarantees,

I am ready to take upon myself the obligation 
not to allow the destruction of Italy.
And this is planned by the Fuhrer himself.

We received a secret order to destroy 
all picture galleries and monuments,

in other words, to destroy all that 
belongs to the history of humanity.

in spite of a personal danger, 
I already saved some old pictures.

I did hide in my hiding-places picture 
from the galleries of Ufitstsi, Topati,

collection of the coins of the 
king of Vittorio Emanuel.

-There Titsian, Ale Greco, Botticelli among them?
-Yes. Ale Greco and Botticelli among them.
How much this could cost in US dollars?

They do not have a price. 
These pictures are priceless.

I am ready to have a business 
with you, general Wolf.
But you must give me your guarantees too.

First of all, you will only have contacts 
with me and no others, except me,

Furthermore, the fact of our negotiations 
must be known only to the people,

who are here present: to you, to me, 
to your colleague and to my associates.

Then we will not be able to conclude 
peace, Mr. Dulles.

You are not yet the US President, and 
I am so far not a Chancellor of Germany.

Shell I report to the President or 
you will report to him yourself?
It's too early for any reports yet.
Please watch the road.

Or we will fall down, and that 
would be sad. The war is almost over.

This is against the political 
line of the President?

First time in my life, I feel 
myself like a criminal.

-And what about you, Gusman? 
-This can cost us heads.
Each day, hour and minute can cost us heads.

We will report this only to our 
to chief Donovan.
Let us look, what a resolution he will make.

The only chance to save Europe from 
the Russian Bolshevism

is to get an armistice with Germans. 
As fast as possible.
And what about Russians?

What about Russians? After a document is 
signed, after it enters into full effect,

it is possible to talk only, but not possible 
to change anything any longer at all.
We'll see what will happen.

The main thing in the politics is the first step, 
determination and the clarity of purpose and

the rest will be forgiven to us 
by the future generations.

Today, on 8 March, troops 53rd army of 
the 2nd Ukrainian front in Czechoslovakia
freed the city of Shtyavnitsa.

Forces of the 3rd Ukrainian front 
continued the attacks

against large forces of tanks and 
infantry in the region of Balaton lake.
during the combat in the region of Balaton lake
a sergeant Smyshlyaev

blew up an enemy tank and perished 
by death of a hero.
Gunners of the anti-tank battalion

Junior Sergeant Nelyubin blew up an enemy 
tank and perished by death of hero.
Today is the international woman's day March 8.

The role of Russian women in 
the this war is enormous,

It was expressed confidence in the fact 
that by the new heroic actions in the

rear and at the front line, the Russian women 
make the day of our victory come sooner.

Today is also published a news, 
that on 1 February, 1945

The Soviet government awarded the 
orders and the medals 72 thousand
woman-soldiers of the Red Army.

44 women-soldiers are awarded the highest 
medal of the Hero of the Soviet Union.

The forces of 2nd Belorussian Front have 
a heavy fight in Gdansk city.

Good evening, pastor. 
I am sorry for coming so late.

- Were you already asleep? 
- Yes. But please don't worry about it.

Please come in. 
Now I will turn on the light in there.

- Did something bad happen?
- Yes, something bad did happen!
End of part 5.
Translated by Fooper01. Enjoy.

comments.text: Make more fanatical comments please! (film is good but why hysterics?)﻿
comments.author: Tõnu Samuel

comments.text:
Из интервью Татьяны Лиозновой:" Наивный чистый русский народ ждал помощи 
союзников. В то время, когда наша страна обливалась кровью, американцы 
готовили договор-перемирие. Вот именно из-за этого  предательского события 
я решила снять этот фильм"﻿
comments.author: sc379teacher

comments.text:
Если честно, то роман намного интересней. В фильме всё наиграно, да и 
актёры играют не убедительно.
comments.author: Denis Baldino

στον διάβολο την παραμονή της νίκης προκειμένου να σταματήσουν τους 
Σοβιετικούς! Και τους δελέασαν με πίνακες του El Greco! Τι συναρπαστική 
ιστορία
Υ.Γ. Ο Άλλαν Ντάλλον είναι καταπληκτικός﻿

comments.text:
фильм дает пищу для размышлений в семидесятые так же, как и сейчас: природа 
людей не меняется...
comments.author: Алексей Бакланов

comments.text: Таких как Тихонов уже никогда не будет.
comments.author: Annaa Ann

comments.text:
ребят, субтитры никто не делал, это автоматический ютубовский перевод на 
основе русских субтитров
comments.author: Nickolas Barmenkov

comments.text: "мы эвакуируемся, зайдите завтра" - это что такое? Когда нас уже не будет?
comments.author: viktor smirnov

comments.text:
This movie deserves much better subtitles. The subtitles author may be 
"good enough" for the Hollywood "simplicity", but here it would have been 
nice to give this movie its due.
comments.author: Amy

comments.text:
Хотелось бы взглянуть просто на того человека кто делал английские 
субтитры, на 37 минуте и как кабак и бар в разговоре мюллера и штирлица 
привратился в секс бар.
comments.author: aleksandr goffman
